events.title: First United States Congress Convenes
events.description: The first Congress of the United States under the new Constitution met in New York City, marking the beginning of the federal government under the U.S. Constitution.
events.significance: This event established the functioning U.S. federal government, shaping the nation's future governance.

events.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt Inaugurated as 32nd U.S. President
events.description: Franklin D. Roosevelt was sworn in as President of the United States and famously declared 'the only thing we have to fear is fear itself' during the Great Depression.
events.significance: Roosevelt's presidency marked the start of significant reforms and New Deal policies to combat the Great Depression.

events.title: Jeannette Rankin Becomes First Woman in U.S. Congress
events.description: Jeannette Rankin of Montana was sworn into the U.S. House of Representatives, becoming the first woman to serve in Congress.
events.significance: This milestone represented a major advance for women's political rights in the United States.

events.title: First Publication of the Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society
events.description: The Royal Society of London began publishing the Philosophical Transactions, the first scientific journal in the world.
events.significance: This event marked a key development in the formal communication and dissemination of scientific knowledge.
